content.question: The chordal seventh in measure 17 is circled. Which of the following describes how the seventh is resolved?

choices.label: It resolves upward on beat three of measure 17.
It resolves upward on beat three of measure 18.
It is retained in the same voice until it resolves downward to the B in measure 18.
It is retained in the same voice until it resolves downward to the B-flat in measure 20.

content.answer: It is retained in the same voice until it resolves downward to the B in measure 18.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
